title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 09 April 2014 - XWiki
content:
<Denis> has joined #xwiki  
00:40 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
04:25 <nodanero> has joined #xwiki  
04:27 <nodanero> hi  
04:31 <nodanero> I'm looking for some option on how can I classify the pages as public/confidential  
04:33 <nodanero> can I archieve it through page template?  
04:36 <nodanero> also, is there any simple documentation that I can follow?  
06:03 <Denis> has quit

09:19 <tmortagne> you should add yourself to https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-ideas/blob/master/pom.xml  
09:19 <msmeria> tmortagne: hi  
09:19 <msmeria> ok, I will. thanks! :)  
09:19 <tmortagne> right now you don't appear as author and you have done all the last commits

10:27 <tmortagne> same for me  
10:27 <sbaloul> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <vmassol> cool :)  
10:32 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <gdelhumeau> what about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension-5.4.x/ ?  
10:42 <xwikiorg\_guest\_3> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <xwikiorg\_guest\_3> has quit  
10:54 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <gdelhumeau> failing tests look like flickers, aren't they ?  
11:13 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: nothing failing in the current build so far, lets wait the end  
11:34 <Slashman> has quit  
11:42 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> hello alla  
11:43 <vmassol> hi guest2  
11:43 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> i'm an enginner software at icosnet in algeria, i wante to intagrate XWIki Solution in our entreprise  
11:43 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> but i hav probleme with xwiki compenent  
11:44 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> can i put my question please  
11:44 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> ?  
11:44 <vmassol> do we know each other? I've been in Algeria once where I've done a training session :)  
11:44 <vmassol> sure shoot!  
11:44 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> good  
11:45 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> can i put my question vmassol  
11:45 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> plaese  
11:45 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> i read in yout wiki that xwiki compenent manager work as OSGI  
11:45 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> when i can do my modify without  
11:46 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> restart my server  
11:46 <vmassol> yes  
11:46 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> that"s right  ?  
11:46 <vmassol> yes  
11:46 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> but i make test  
11:46 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> i create my component with maven  
11:46 <vmassol> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WritingComponents and http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Component+Module  
11:46 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> the problem  
11:47 <vmassol> you can register and remove components on the fly against the component maager  
11:47 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> the modify can't be execute without restart my server  
11:47 <vmassol> \*manager  
11:47 <vmassol> I don't know what 'modify' means  
11:47 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> ah ok  
11:47 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> modify == update source code of component  
11:48 <vmassol> if you change the component's implementation you'll need to unergister the componet before making changes and then reregister it  
11:48 <vmassol> (after the new impl has been loaded in the CL)  
11:52 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> OK, i gonna try it and if don't work i return to you,  
11:52 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> and thanks for you vmassol  
11:53 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> xwiki is good tools  
11:53 <vmassol> cool  
11:53 <vmassol> glad you like it  
11:54 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> we wante integrate xwiki in our entreprise, i want to be sur that it work as osgi. change can be execute without restart.  
11:54 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> thanks for you, and see you soon  
11:54 <vmassol> the main difference with osgi is that osgi uses different classloader for each bundle  
11:55 <gdelhumeau> since 5.4.x has built without any failing test, I propose to release it right now  
11:55 <vmassol> while xwiki uses a single CL  
11:55 <vmassol> practically this means you cannot install conflicting extensions in xwiki  
11:55 <vmassol> in osgi you can have version 1.0 of extA and also version 2.0 of extA working side by side  
11:56 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> yes that right  
11:56 <vmassol> you get this at the cost of hugely increased complexity which we chose to not have ;)  
11:59 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> ok, thanks for this clarify ;)  
12:00 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: +  
12:00 <tmortagne> +1  
12:00 <gdelhumeau> let's go  
12:12 <msmeria> has quit  
12:13 <nodanero> hi  
12:13 <nodanero> I'm looking for options on how can I classify the pages as public/confidential  
12:13 <gdelhumeau> [ANN] Start the release of 5.4.4, no mroe commit please  
12:14 <nodanero> can I archieve it through page template?  
12:14 <vmassol> nodanero: you can put them in different spaces and set permissions at space level  
12:14 <vmassol> dpeending on your use case you can also create an xclass  
12:14 <nodanero> I'm looking to have it at document level  
12:15 <vmassol> check the FAQ tutorial for that  
12:15 <nodanero> ok  
12:15 <vmassol> you can add custom metadata to pages  
12:15 <vmassol> (that's what we call xclass &xobjects)  
12:15 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:16 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> has quit  
12:16 <nodanero> could I show it like a drop down when editing the page?  
12:16 <vmassol> sure  
12:17 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
12:18 <Emenems> has quit  
12:19 <nodanero> I will follow http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/FAQTutorialManual  
12:19 <nodanero> thank you!  
12:19 <vmassol> yw  
12:20 <nodanero> has left #xwiki  
12:20 <spu7nic> has joined #xwiki  
12:24 <gdelhumeau> what about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-cluster-5.4.x/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-cluster/testReport/org.xwiki.test.cluster/DocumentCacheTest/testDocumentCacheSyncForAttachments/ ?  
13:02 <spu7nic> Hi ;)  
13:02 <spu7nic> Did anyone ever modify the livetableresults macro for custom mappings?  
13:27 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
13:28 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
13:40 <sbaloul> has quit  
13:58 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:02 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
14:35 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:54 <Slashman> has quit  
15:10 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <cjd> haha I \*almost\* set the user object to inactive  
15:16 <vmassol> :)  
15:16 <vmassol> does that take immediate effect?  
15:17 <vmassol> might be a better solution  
15:17 <cjd> mmm not sure, we'll find out in a sec  
15:31 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <Denis> has quit  
15:32 <spu7nic> Hmmm, is it possible to get invoke getCustomMapping from velocity?  
15:34 <cjd> in XWikiHibernateStore?  
15:34 <cjd> $xcontext.getContext().getWiki().getHibernatrStore().getCustomMapping()  ??  
15:35 <cjd> \*getHibernateStore()  
15:35 <spu7nic> From a xWikiClass :)  
15:35 <spu7nic> I try to patch the LiveTableResults to accept custom mapped classes  
15:36 <cjd> if you have programming rights, anything is possible  
15:37 <spu7nic> I do, but $instance.getxWikiClass().getCustomMapping() does not return anything :/  
15:37 <cjd> $instance.getxWikiClass()  
15:37 <cjd> see what it says  
15:37 <cjd> it will tell you the className  
15:37 <cjd> $instance.getxWikiClass().getClass().getName() too  
15:38 <spu7nic> http://maven.xwiki.org/site/docs/xwiki-javadoc-4.1.x/com/xpn/xwiki/api/Class.html  
15:38 <spu7nic> It should return a BaseClass  
15:38 <spu7nic> Which has a http://maven.xwiki.org/site/docs/xwiki-javadoc-4.1.x/com/xpn/xwiki/objects/classes/BaseClass.html#getCustomMapping()() method  
15:38 <cjd> ahh  
15:38 <cjd> hasCustomMapping()  
15:39 <cjd> try that one  
15:39 <cjd> It's likely that something else went wrong and the class isn't \*actually\* custom mapped according to the core  
15:40 <spu7nic> My problem is, getxWikiClass return an com.xpn.xwiki.api.Class  
15:40 <spu7nic> Instead of BaseObject  
15:41 <cjd> s/BaseObject/BaseClass/  
15:42 <cjd> you probably want   getxWikiClass().getXWikiClass()  
15:42 <spu7nic> And even $instance.getxWikiClass().getxWikiClass() returns com.xpn.xwiki.api.Class ^^  
15:42 <cjd> careful of capital letters  
15:43 <cjd> public Class getxWikiClass()  
15:43 <cjd> public BaseClass getXWikiClass()  
15:43 <cjd> $instance.getxWikiClass().getXWikiClass()  
15:43 <spu7nic> Oh, that may be the problem  
15:44 <spu7nic> ^^  
15:44 <spu7nic> That solved my issue :) - thanks a lot  
15:44 <cjd> sure thing  
15:44 <cjd> glad I could help  
15:44 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
15:44 <spu7nic> without Code Completion those issues are a little difficult to track ^^  
15:46 <cjd> yeah, personally I write using a plain text editor so my code is very explicit about where symbols are to be found  
15:46 <cjd> usually I name functions starting with the file/document where they're defined  
15:53 <Slashman> has quit  
15:56 <spu7nic> ;)
